Class GravityField

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      PointlikeBody
          GravityField
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class GravityField
extends PointlikeBody

A uniform force field with constant magnitude and direction.

Its base structure is the same as the PointlikeBody. In addition it possesses a force vector g. Can move and be acted on by another force if its mass is declared to a nonzero value. Its method, calcuating the acting forces, had to be modified to function correctly.

See Also:
PointlikeBody

Constructor Detail

GravityField

GravityField(double m,
             Dimension p,
             Dimension v,
             Dimension g,
             PHYModel phymodel,
             String name)
Perfect definition of the object, assigning mass, position, velocity, g, model and name.

It gets the main attributes, and also an instance of the PHYModel class. Very important to use this constructor and to specify the phymodel object. Otherwise the body will have no connection to other objects, declared to live inside a different system.

Parameters:
m - mass to be assigned
p - position to be assigned
v - speed to be assigned
g - g constant of the force field to be assigned
phymodel - the model object which holds all the other bodies
name - name to be assigned
Method Detail

act

public Dimension act(double m)
Returns the applied force to a body with mass m.

proceeds by the formula F = m*g

Parameters:
m - the mass of the body to act on
Returns:
the force vector applied on the given body by this field

calculateActingForces

protected Dimension calculateActingForces()
The modified version of the calulcateActingForces() from the PointlikeBody class for spaces.

I had to override this function because of the way the PointlikeBody caluclates forces. It involves checking forces that apply to this actual object. In case of a force, we should not consider the actual one as an acting force during the calculation. Otherwise each force would make itself accelerate.

Overrides:
calculateActingForces in class PointlikeBody
Returns:
a Dimension object representing the resulting force acting on the body

getG

public Dimension getG()
Returns the g property of the object.

Returns:
the vector holding x and y components of the force measured in N*kg.

setG

public void setG(Dimension g)
Sets the g property of the object.

Parameters:
g - the vector holding x and y components of the force measured in N*kg.
